{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hypercementosis is characterized by the excessive buildup of normal cementum on the roots of one or more teeth. It can be caused by many factors, both local and systemic. According to Document [2], it can be one of the complications of Paget's disease of bone in the form of generalized hypercementosis. Document [27] also mentions a case of generalized hypercementosis, but the cause is not specified. None of the other documents mention hypophosphatasia, achondroplasia, or fibrous dysplasia polyostotic type in relation to hypercementosis.", "answer_choice": "C. Pagets disease"}
